channel.title: Daily News Feed Update #1
channel.description: Daily collected titles from multiple sources

item.title: Bangla Editorials (Update #1) • প্রবীণদের কল্যাণে বাংলাদেশ সরকারের উদ্যোগ: আশা ও হতাশা
English Editorials (Update #1) • Starvation is a war crime. So why is it so rarely prosecuted • Is Bangladesh prepared to face quake consequence?

Magazines (Update #1) • Jane Goodall’s Legacy of Challenging What It Means to Be a Scientist • This U.S. Government Shutdown Is Very Bad for Science • How Many People Have Ever Lived on Earth? • Should we worry AI will create deadly bioweapons? Not yet, but one day • Antarctica may have crossed a tipping point that leads to rising seas • Rogue planet gains 6 billion tonnes per second in record growth spurt • How Jane Goodall changed the way we see animals – and the world • How playing a musical instrument helps children learn to read

International (Update #1) • Kenyan activists abducted after joining opposition rally in Uganda • Organisers call for sixth night of protest as Morocco death toll rises to three • ‘We are the last hope’: Gen Z Madagascar vows to fight on until president resigns • Trump officials push claim that US in ‘armed conflict’ with drug cartels • Treasure hunters discover $1m in silver and gold coins off Florida coast • Judge denies Kilmar Ábrego García’s bid for asylum in the US • Part of Pablo Escobar’s ranch to be given to female victims of Colombia conflict • Canadian government asked to clarify whether Kneecap barred from country • Asylum seekers on Nauru going hungry despite government spending $1.5m a year for each person • PNG to provide troops to Australia under first new alliance since Anzus • Australia news live: planned pro-Palestine protest at Opera House could be tested in the supreme court, police say • SA Ambulance received no alerts from service meant to notify authorities during Optus triple zero outage last month • ‘Won’t be silenced’: court outburst by former NSW police officer accused of double murder • Public hospital psychiatrists to receive 20% pay rise after winning dispute with NSW Health • At least five Australians reportedly detained while carrying aid to Gaza on pro-Palestinian flotilla • Munich drone sightings force airport to cancel flights in latest Europe disruption • Putin dismisses fears that Moscow plans to attack Nato as ‘nonsense’ • ‘A paroxysm of disposability’: France’s distaste for Shein’s ultra-fast fashion • UK and EU poised to strike deal sparing British business from carbon border tax • Europe needs political will to act and cut ties with Russia, says Zelenskyy after leaders summit – as it happened • Israel stops 41 boats in aid flotilla with one ‘still sailing strong’ • Hamas to demand key revisions to Trump Gaza plan before accepting, sources say • Iran may release hundreds of thousands of Afghan refugees into Iraq and Turkey • Iran must move its capital from Tehran, says president as water crisis worsens • At least 53 Palestinians killed in fresh wave of Israeli attacks on Gaza • Six minutes of terror: how Manchester synagogue attack unfolded • Manchester attack: two killed and three injured after terrorist drives into grounds of synagogue and stabs worshippers • Prince William describes agenda of ‘change for the good’ when king • Call to allow ‘safe and effective’ at-home abortions up to 12 weeks in UK • Reform UK council in Nottinghamshire ends ban on local journalists • US government shutdown: Donald Trump promises firings and cuts to ‘Democrats’ favorite projects’ if shutdown continues – as it happened • Anti-abortion groups furious as FDA approves generic abortion pill • California vows to ‘instantly’ cut funding to universities that cave to Trump ‘compact’ • Government shutdown could cost US economy billions of dollars a week, analysts say • ‘Cancel Netflix’: Elon Musk leads rightwing backlash over trans character in kids’ show
Geopolitics (Update #1) • Reclaiming Europe’s Digital Sovereignty • The Most Violent Chapter of Israel and Palestine
